problem_text:
a) Let t be an involution of a finite group G and suppose that the set D = tG ∪ {txty | x, y ∈ G, |txty| = 2} does not intersect O2(G). Prove that if t ∈ O2(C(d)) for any involution d from CD(t), then D = tG (and in this case the structure of the group ⟨D⟩ is known).
b) A significantly more general question. Let t be an involution of a finite group G and suppose that t ∈ Z∗(N(X)) for every non-trivial subgroup X of odd order which is normalized, but not centralized, by t. What is the group
tG ?
A. A. Makhnëv
